docs.lead_paragraph:
HILL--James I.,

retired, President of Evelyn Hill Inc, Statue of Liberty, passed away on November 1, at age 89. He was born on Liberty Island, where his father Aaron Hill founded the concession in 1931. He joined his mother Evelyn Hill in operating the concession, retiring after 47 years. He attended DeWitt Clinton High School, Riverside Academy, and NYU. He proudly served during WWII in the United States Air Force as a gunner on a B-29. After a lengthy and courageous battle with lung cancer, he died peacefully, with his devoted wife, Racelle, by his side. Survived by four children, Bradford and Christopher Hill, Ted Halpern, and Susan Halpern, and many grandchildren. His first wife Joan predeceased him. "Gentleman Jim", best known for his gentle nature, good humor, generosity, and friendship. Many say they are better people for having known him. He will be missed. Donations may be made in Jim's honor to Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, 1275 York Ave., NY, NY 10065.

docs.lead_paragraph:
JOHNSON--Camellia.

Marble Collegiate Church will host a memorial service for Metropolitan Opera soprano Camellia Johnson on Saturday, November 14 at 3pm. Colleagues and friends will perform a musical tribute in the Sanctuary where her singing touched so many over four decades. She has sung with a number of world-class orchestras, as a recitalist at Lincoln Center's Alice Tully Hall, as well as performing for Presidents Bill Clinton and Barack Obama at the White House.

docs.lead_paragraph: Deep disregard for the news media has allowed candidates to ridicule assertions from outlets they dislike as they play loose with the facts.
docs.snippet: Deep disregard for the news media has allowed candidates to ridicule assertions from outlets they dislike as they play loose with the facts....
docs.abstract: Candidates in 2016 presidential field have been caught twisting truth on number of occasions, but being caught lying appears to be less damaging than it once was as race grows more chaotic; have managed to sow distrust of news media and have often thrown accusations of untruth back at reporters.

headline.print_headline: Candidates Stick to Script, If Not the Truth
headline.main: Candidates Stick to Script, if Not the Truth, in the 2016 Race

docs.lead_paragraph: Whether she wins or not, Hillary Clinton — the wife of a former president, with the longest résumé in the room — is a perfect transitional figure.
docs.snippet: Whether she wins or not, Hillary Clinton — the wife of a former president, with the longest résumé in the room — is a perfect transitional figure....
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column, noting that Hillary Rodham Clinton is only woman who has ever won a presidential primary, examines history of women who have run for Oval Office, starting in 1872 when Victoria Woodhull ran on Equal Rights Party ticket; holds Clinton, whose list of qualifications are longest in 2016 race, has raised bar for women, making her perfect transitional figure whatever the outcome.
